* Represents a duke chatbot object that stores a task list,
* users can add / delete / mark / unmark / list tasks using this chatbot.
* starts the chatbot up, interacts with user commands, and ends until user enters 'bye' command.
* Represents an exception thrown when an error occurs during duke chatbot execution.
* Represents duke chatbot parser that make sense of user commands.
* Returns a LocalDate object parsed from a string containing date.
* If the string date format is not accepted, exception is thrown.
* @param str a string containing a date.
* @throws DukeException If the string date format is not accepted by duke chatbot.
public LocalDate parseDate(String str) throws DukeException {
// parse string format date to LocalDate object -> to String format yyyy-MM-dd, exception
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! This is not a proper time format, "
* Returns simplified command string parsed from a user command.
* If the command is invalid, exception is thrown.
* @param line a string containing a user command.
* @return command string understandable by other methods/classes.
* @throws DukeException If the command is regarded invalid/incomplete by duke chatbot.
public String parseCommand(String line, TaskList taskList) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException ("☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a Todo task cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The command not properly formatted.\n" +
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a Deadline task cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The command not properly formatted.\n"
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The command not properly formatted.\n"
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a Event task cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The start date of a Event task cannot be after end date.");
if (taskIndex.equals("") || !taskIndex.matches("[0-9]+")) { // task description empty or not numeric
throw new DukeException(String.format("☹ OOPS!!! The task index of a %s command cannot be empty.",
throw new DukeException("☹ OOPS!!! The task index exceeds task list size limit.");

* Represents a storage for the task list, provides save/load task list methods.
* Task list is saved in / loaded from specified file path.
* Saves the task list in the location indicated by filepath as a txt file.
* Loads the task list from the location indicated by filepath.
* If the filepath doesn't exist, empty task list is loaded.
* Chatbot users can perform add/delete/mark operations on the tasks in the list.
* Prints all tasks in the task list.
* Each task printed consists of task type, status, description, (date);
* task types (todo, event, deadline) are represented by [T], [E], [D],
* task status (done, undone) are represented by [X], [ ].
* Returns the string format of task list to be saved to storage.
* Each task string consists of task type, status, description, (date);
* The format is | task type | status | description | time
String result = "Task Type | Status | Description & Time\n";
* Returns the number of tasks in the task list.
* Returns the task at an index in the task list (the index method starts from 0).
* The task at index is deleted from the task list.
* Returns the task at an index in the task list (the index method starts from 1).
* Adds the task at the end of the task list.
* @param t task to add to list.
* Marks a task at task index as done and returns the marked task.
* Marks a task at task index as undone and returns the marked task.
* Returns a task list containing unfinished tasks on the date.
* The task list includes unfinished deadline tasks with end date after/on the specified date,
* and unfinished event tasks with the specified date between start and end date.
* Represents duke chatbot Ui that user sees.
* Prints duke chatbot start up message that user sees when he/her opens duke chatbot.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Duke, your personalized chatbot to arrange your tasks!");
System.out.println("Duke allows you to freely add, delete, mark task status, search tasks by time, " +
System.out.println("Please type 'help' command for more information on Duke task types and command format.");
* Prints duke information message that user sees when he/her uses help command to get information about duke chatbot.
* The information includes task type, command format, and other notes.
System.out.println("There are 3 types of task implemented: "
+ "\n1. todo     : tasks without any date/time attached to it"
+ "\n2. deadline : tasks that need to be done before a specific date/time"
+ "\n3. event    : tasks that start at a specific time and ends at a specific time");
System.out.println("Below is all the command you can use: ");
System.out.println("  2. Add deadline        | deadline {task description} /by {end date}");
System.out.println("  3. Add event           | event {task description} /at {start date} to {end date}");
System.out.println("  4. Delete task         | delete {task index in the list}");
System.out.println("  5. Mark task as done   | mark {task index in the list}");
System.out.println("  6. Mark task as undone | unmark {task index in the list}");
System.out.println("1. Acceptable date formats include dd/MM/yyyy, yyyy/MM/dd, yyyy-MM-dd, dd-MM-yyyy, ");
System.out.println("   dd MM yyyy, yyyy MM dd.");
System.out.println("2. Task list will be auto-saved after bye command and auto-loaded when chatbot starts up.");
* Prints duke chatbot message after user add, delete task, and mark tasks as done or undone.
* @param index index of a task that is added / deleted / marked / unmarked.
public void printAddCommandUi(String command, String index, TaskList taskList) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println(String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list.", taskList.getSize()));
System.out.println(String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list.", taskList.getSize()));
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Prints duke chatbot message after user list tasks and list unfinished tasks at a date.
* @param taskList task list to be printed.
public void printListCommandUi(String command, String date, TaskList taskList) {
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("Here are unfinished tasks on this date in your list:");
* Prints duke chatbot ending message that user sees when he/her stops/exits duke chatbot.
System.out.println("Chatbot stopped, all previous tasks will be auto-saved :D");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints message when task list storage loading occurs.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS!!! Loading error occurred, new text file is created for task list storage.");
* Prints message when task list storage saving occurs.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS!!! Saving error occurred, task list not properly saved in the text file.");
* Prints error message when an exception is raised possibly because of inproper commands.
